description.narrative: (i) Reduction of CO2 and other GHGs: Fund will invest in renewable energy and cleaner technology projects, thus contributing to a reduction in carbon emissions; (ii) Economic and private sector development: Fund will provide equity capital and project financing to help promote growth and job creation in local communities; (iii) Demonstration Effects: Fund will strengthen investees both from a financial and governance perspective and help them scale up their operations ,thus making them more attractive targets for investment and acquisition. This will help to demonstrate the business case for renewable energy and clean technology projects and encourage private investors to invest in this sector.

The proposal is for a US$15 million equity investment, not to exceed 20% of total commitments, in the Latin Renewable Infrastructure Fund LP (LRIF or the Fund), a 10-year closed-end private equity fund seeking to raise US$150 million to invest in 8-12 infrastructure projects in the renewable power and energy efficiency sectors of Latin America and the Caribbean (LAC).

name.narrative: The Fund will be a Delaware limited partnership (LP). The fund management company (REAL) will be a Delaware limited liability company. The Fund will make investments in Latin America and the Caribbean (LAC) with a particular focus on Central America, the Caribbean and selected countries in South America (Peru and Colombia).
